subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: My take on this ridiculous MiniBox War 07' on here
author: Frank Sumption

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Thanks Bill!!!!!
 
 I have only two boxes at the moment, one is not meant =
for travel, as I have it set up with a seperate power supply, and sound cha=
mber for testing. The other is the new printed circuit version that has a c=
ouple problems still.  I showed this one at the Stanley over the weekend. T=
here is the box made by paranormalsystems.com, it works, and there is a sou=
nd sample on the site. I saw the Mini Box at the Stanley and was impressed.=
 
 
  Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: vilhellm@...=
: Mon, 19 Nov 2007 11:29:25 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: My take on this rid=
iculous MiniBox War 07' on here




Judy, I'm near Hollywood and I work wit=
h a small group of like mindedresearchers. We have a Frank's Box and you'll=
 never, ever have to eventhink we would ask for anything from you to partic=
ipate in a Boxsession. -Bill--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "judy_in_hollyw=
ood"<Ticket_to_Heaven@...> wrote:>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve =
Hultay" <urkel23@> wrote:> >> > > > I started the research with a box i was=
 lucky to have made based > off > > of Frank's idea. As all on this board o=
ne way or another would > have > > done anything to get their hands on one =
of Frank's boxes or > > something equivalent. So, now it's your chance to g=
et another > > version of an already great idea and everyone's complaining.=
 Isn't > > this the answer to everyone's problem, it may be pricey but i kn=
ow > > people who would have paid more in the past for a similar item. > > =
This board is for research, this is just another idea just like > > Joe's i=
dea of joe's box and frank's "frank's box". If this version > > doesn't wor=
k, than the idea will kill itself. But, now people can > > get to see if th=
ey are truly meant to work with the other side or > > one of the 30 or 80 o=
r whatever the number is up to now. I think > if > > you don't like this mi=
nibox than don't buy it, but isn't anybody > > curious to see the results p=
eople get with it or don't. Just my > > take on it, i think it's crazy that=
 everyone is getting so upset > > about another form of communication. It t=
ook me back at first > > because i felt this would kill my research, but we=
 don't know if > > this even works yet. These things happen for a reason by=
 stuff out > > of our control. All we can do is sit back and watch, and who=
 > didn't > > think someone was going to mass produce this idea eventually =
> > anyway? > > > > -Steve H.> >> - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -=
 - - - - - - - - - - - -> Hi Steve H., My thoughts are if the boxes DO work=
 well for > those that are truely interested in doing research with them - =
> daily!! I'd still like to experience one, but am in L.A. - where no > one=
's doing Public demos of it =3D UGH! Chris -who was in San diego > today wa=
nts $125. for the admission!! Yikes! =3DJudy=3D>

 <BR>
 I have only two boxes at&=
nbsp;the moment, one is not meant for travel, as I have it set up&nbsp=
;with a seperate power supply, and sound chamber for testing. The othe=
r is the new printed circuit version that has a couple problems still. &nbs=
p;I showed this one at the Stanley over the weekend. There is the box made =
by paranormalsystems.com, it works, and there is a sound sample on the site=
. I saw the Mini Box at the Stanley and was impressed. <BR>
 <BR>=

  Frank-S<BR><BR><BR>
